author: Meichen Li
description:
Unlike influenza virus, Ebola Virus spikes protein bound to an antibody from a human survivor. Ebola had five strains and it mutates. However, if we can find the similarities these five strains Ebola virus share, we can easily target the main protein and find the drugs to block out the signaling of Ebola protein.
Further more, the cured patients can donate their blood plasma for further research. Since they develop the certain antibodies, we can contrast their blood plasma before getting infected with Ebola and after they survived.
summary: There is currently no licensed cure for Ebola due to its complicity.  Even though Ebola and Influenza are both RNA Virus, Ebola has different structure and thus functions differently in the pathway. To cure Ebola, we can find the  similarity between Ebola virus and Influenza Virus.
title: The new ideas to approach to the Ebola Virus issue solving.
